featuredGuests.name: Sheryl Sandberg
featuredGuests.briefSummary: Sheryl Sandberg is the Chief Operating Officer of Facebook, where she oversees the company's business operations. She is a prominent figure in the tech industry and an advocate for women's empowerment in the workplace.

featuredGuests.name: Tim Berners-Lee
featuredGuests.designation: Inventor of the World Wide Web
featuredGuests.briefSummary: Tim Berners-Lee is the inventor of the World Wide Web and a pioneer in the field of computer science. His groundbreaking invention revolutionized the way we share and access information, and he continues to be a leading voice in promoting an open and accessible web.

featuredGuests.name: Ginni Rometty
featuredGuests.briefSummary: Ginni Rometty is a technology executive and the former CEO of IBM. During her tenure, she led the company through a transformative era, focusing on emerging technologies like artificial intelligence and cloud computing.

featuredGuests.name: Reshma Saujani
featuredGuests.briefSummary: Reshma Saujani is an entrepreneur and the founder of Girls Who Code, a non-profit organization dedicated to closing the gender gap in technology. Her work has empowered thousands of young girls to pursue careers in tech and become future leaders.

featuredGuests.name: Jensen Huang
featuredGuests.briefSummary: Jensen Huang is the CEO and co-founder of NVIDIA, a leading technology company specializing in graphics processing units (GPUs) and artificial intelligence. Under his leadership, NVIDIA has become a driving force in the advancement of GPU technology and AI applications.

featuredGuests.name: Marillyn Hewson
featuredGuests.briefSummary: Marillyn Hewson is a renowned business executive and the former CEO of Lockheed Martin, one of the world's largest defense contractors. She played a key role in driving innovation and shaping the aerospace industry.
